intro: Lophosciadium lophopterum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nightshade, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that range in color from yellow to red. It is native to regions in southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
